intro: Paepalanthus chloronema, commonly known as the green-hair cactus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cactaceae. It is native to South America, particularly found in regions of Argentina and Chile. This plant is characterized by its cylindrical stems covered in short, greenish-gray spines. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom during the spring and summer seasons. Paepalanthus chloronema is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
